<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module4_mcq_q80')" data-correct-answer="A">
  <strong style="display: block;">A portfolio manager states that diversifiable risk sometimes commands a premium because not all investors diversify. Which is the CAPM-consistent response?</strong>
<label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q80" value="A"> A. Even if some investors do not diversify, equilibrium prices reflect the average investor, who is assumed to diversify.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q80" value="B"> B. CAPM explicitly rewards diversifiable risk.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q80" value="C"> C. CAPM does not apply to large investors.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q80" value="D"> D. Diversifiable risk becomes systematic if investors ignore it.</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module4_mcq_q80" value="E"> E. CAPM assumes no investor holds a diversified portfolio.</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module4_mcq_q80" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
